article.headline: Southern Miss. 80, Reinhardt 56
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Craig Craft scored a career-high 17 points to lead Southern Mississippi to an 80-56 win over Reinhardt on Tuesday. The Golden Eagles (8-1) are off to their best start in six years. The team's only loss came against No. 10 Alabama on Saturday. Reinhardt (10-7) dropped its second straight game. The Golden Eagles pulled away from a tight 28-24 score with a 13-0 run to end the first half. Sai'Quon Stone and Craft scored nine points in the first half and Southern Miss took a 41-24 halftime lead. Reinhardt never cut the deficit to single digits in the second half. Craft led five Southern Miss players in double figures -- Jarvis Hill added 15, Stone chipped in 13 and Andre Stephens and Demar Dotson scored 11 apiece. Stephens added seven rebounds and Dewayne Green dished out nine assists. Carl Williams scored 24 points and grabbed eight rebounds for Reinhardt.
